sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hello, you're watching Euronews now. Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A raft of new Covid measures are introduced in France, Austria and parts of Germany as cases continue to soar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But in England, authorities rule out a revision of restrictions before the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Belarus puts forward draft amendments to the country's constitution that could see President Lukashenko remain in power until 2035.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And we take a look at the film that has defied the odds of the pandemic and made over a billion dollars at the box office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The French government announced new Covid measures on Monday evening after a record

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 100,000 cases were recorded on Christmas day, the highest daily figure in the country since the pandemic began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Proof of vaccination will be necessary to enter restaurants, bars, cinemas and other public venues from January 15th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the wait time between the second vaccine and the booster shot has also been reduced to just three months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: New restrictions to tackle a rise in coronavirus infections will come into force across large parts of Germany on December 28th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Vaccinated people can meet privately in groups of 10, while the unvaccinated can only meet in pairs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Reactions to the new measures are mixed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This Berliner says, I find that the arrangements make sense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I have adapted to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I find that they work well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I don't see any major restrictions in my private life, so to speak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While another said, the rules are very different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It would be better if they were the same for all German states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile across the border in Austria, where a lockdown for the unvaccinated is still in place, the hospitality sector will be required to stop service at 10pm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This will affect New Year's Eve events and will come as a blow for many business owners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This local caf√© owner says an earlier closing time always means less business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's getting harder and harder.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland have put limits on social gatherings in time for New Year's Eve, 10 Downing Street says no new steps will be taken in England before the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has instead emphasised the importance of personal responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And in Portugal, where Covid tests are mandatory for travellers before departing from most destinations, hundreds of people either transiting or trying to return home or refuse boarding at lisbon airport amid a covert test shortage with more on the raft of new restrictions in france i'm now joined by our international

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: correspondent annelise borges annelise next week is going to look very different for the french what has the reaction been?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Well, the French had been expecting a tightening of restrictions and in fact many here anticipated even harsher measures. So there is a sense of relief that restaurants, bars and cafes will remain open. For now, many people are talking about their New Year's plans and saying that they can still go and meet with friends. Of course, the government decided not to opt for that curfew on the 31st of December. The objective of authorities, and we heard yesterday from the prime minister and the health minister here in this country, is not to halt the spread of Omicron, but to slow it down. That is the the most important and a key strategy in this fight is that vaccine pass and that has many people up in arms here in this country because transforming the health pass that we have been using for months now to access restaurants and cafes and movie theaters will effectively make life much harder for those people who chose not to get a jab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Have hospitals been under strain and has the medical community welcomed the news?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France has been registering an average of 70,000 new daily infections for the last week or so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There are more than 3,000 patients being treated in intensive care right now. So many doctors and nurses across the country saying that what the government is doing or has done, at least in this new package of measures, is actually very little and maybe even too late. They have been asking, for example, for the government to impose harsher measures and to postpone the return to the classroom for students.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They had been asking for the government to postpone, to extend the vacation, so that they could deal with the influx of patients they are expecting to come and knock on their door after the holidays. The government decided not to do so, and many doctors are disappointed indeed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It really seems that the French government, the French administration, is at least for now trying to buy some time, trying to understand what the priorities are going to be over the next few weeks and months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Why? Because this is an electoral year here in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The French will go to the polls to vote for a new president or to re-elect the current one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And there's a lot of political pressure on the administration of Emmanuel Macron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Whatever decisions are made at the government level often find a lot of criticism from political opponents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So it's going to be very interesting to see how this new round of measures plays out in that debate in the coming days. Annalise Borges, thank you very much for that update.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Negotiators from Iran and Five World Powers have resumed talks in Vienna

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: on restoring the 2015 nuclear deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Iran is insisting that the US and its allies allow it to resume crude oil exports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is the eighth round of talks after former US President Donald Trump withdrew the US from the accord in 2018.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Negotiations will be very hard, according to the diplomat chairing the talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

Here on the table, the only thing we have is how to negotiate a text that will include practical steps from Iran and from the United States to go back to full compliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Iran's petrochemical industry, the mainstay of its economy, has suffered greatly since the resumption of US sanctions in 2018. It hopes that a deal can revive its financial position. However, spurred on by fears of what a sanction-free Iran may bring, Israel is arguing that Western powers should keep up the pressure on the Islamic Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: IRAN IS SYSTEMATICALLY DECEIVING THE WORLD. ALL IRAN CARES ABOUT IS THE LIFTING OF SANCTIONS ALLOWING FOR BILLIONS OF DOLLARS TO POUR INTO THEIR NUCLEAR PROGRAM. HEZBOLLAH, SYRIA, IRAQ AND THE TERRORIST NETWORK THEY HAVE DEPLOYED AROUND THE WORLD.
